freenet.node.updater
Class NodeUpdateManager

java.lang.Object
  freenet.node.updater.NodeUpdateManager

public class NodeUpdateManager
extends Object

Supervises NodeUpdater's. Enables us to easily update multiple files, change the URI's on the fly, eliminates some messy code in the callbacks etc.

maybeCreate

public static NodeUpdateManager maybeCreate(Node node,
                                            Config config)
                                     throws InvalidConfigValueException
Create a NodeUpdateManager. Called by node constructor.

Parameters:
node - The node object.
config - The global config object. Options will be added to a subconfig called node.updater.
Returns:
A new NodeUpdateManager
Throws:
InvalidConfigValueException - If there is an error in the config.

getURI

public FreenetURI getURI(boolean isExt)
Get the URI for either the freenet.jar updater or the freenet-ext.jar updater.

Parameters:
isExt - If true, return the freenet-ext.jar update URI; if false, return the freenet.jar URI.
Returns:
See above.

setURI

public void setURI(boolean isExt,
                   FreenetURI uri)
Set the URI for either the freenet.jar updater or the freenet-ext.jar updater.

Parameters:
isExt - If true, set the freenet-ext.jar update URI; if false, set the freenet.jar update URI.
uri - The URI to set.

isAutoUpdateAllowed

public boolean isAutoUpdateAllowed()
Returns:
Is auto-update currently enabled?

setAutoUpdateAllowed

public void setAutoUpdateAllowed(boolean val)
Enable or disable auto-update.

Parameters:
val - If true, enable auto-update (and immediately update if an update is ready). If false, disable it.

blow

public void blow(String msg,
                 boolean disabledNotBlown)
Parameters:
msg -
disabledNotBlown - If true, the auto-updating system is broken, and should be disabled, but the problem *could* be local e.g. out of disk space and a node sends us a revocation certificate.

Is the node able to update as soon as the revocation fetch has been completed?

canUpdateImmediately

public boolean canUpdateImmediately()
Is the node able to update *immediately*? (i.e. not only is it ready in every other sense, but also a revocation fetch has completed recently enough not to need another one)
